body: Sounds good! Maybe we can reduce to scope of #17446 to just deprecating `no-new-symbol` and recommend `no-new-native-nonconstructor` in this issue instead, if this makes more sense.

> Did I miss some rules we added in v8?

Running

```shell
git diff v7.32.0 origin/main --name-only --diff-filter=A lib/rules/*.js
```

only shows source files for the seven rules mentioned in this issue.

rename.from: Change Request: Add new rules to `eslint:recommended` for v9.0.0

body: We should also remove `no-extra-semi` and `no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs`, as they are deprecated.

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[x] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

Fixes #17596

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Updated `eslint:recommended` configuration (`@eslint/js` package) for ESLint v9:

* Added new rules `no-constant-binary-expression`, `no-empty-static-block`, and `no-unused-private-class-members`.
* Removed deprecated rules `no-extra-semi` and `no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs`.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

I verified that all tests will still pass when we release `@eslint/js` with these changes.

I also enabled `no-extra-semi` in eslint-config-eslint so that we keep using this rule when linting (it was enabled via `eslint:recommended`) after we release `@eslint/js`. `no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs` was already explicitly enabled in eslint-config-eslint. I didn't remove `no-constant-binary-expression` so that it keeps working after we merge this but before we release `@eslint/js`. After we release `@eslint/js`, we can remove it from eslint-config-eslint.

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->

body: `no-useless-rename` is a stylistic rule. As described in [Using eslint:recommended](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/configuration-files#using-eslintrecommended), this configuration enables only rules that report possible problems (possible logic errors in code).

Imo `no-useless-rename` isn't a stylistic rule. It is detecting dead code like `no-unused-vars` which is included in the recommended set.

Would it help if the rule was named `no-unused-rename`?
@Pyrolistical the changes have already been decided upon so we won't be adding any other rules to `eslint:recommended` for v9.
